beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. The 300m climb over 5. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Genuine adventure elements. Expect the unexpected. Starting in the Formula 1 arena before transitioning onto the legendary Nordschleife creates unique motorsport crossover appeal. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. Racing gravel in the shadow of the Nordschleife has atmosphere—the Eifel region knows how to host motorsport events. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. You're getting access to the Nürburgring complex and Eifel region for what's presumably reasonable German event pricing. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Renée notes glass shards scattered across "the most technical descent," forcing cautious line selection and significant time loss. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mild conditions. Nothing dramatic. 2025 conditions were "hot and oppressive with bone-dry, dusty conditions" that caught riders unprepared.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Community. 2 out of 5. Riders acknowledge each other. Barely. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Budget carefully. The extras get you. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Sparse start line. Plenty of elbow room.
